Name.label: Autosomal dominant Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 2 with giant axons

TextSection.Contents: A rare subtype of axonal hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy characterized by distal muscle weakness and atrophy (principally of peroneal muscles) associated with distal sensory loss (tactile, vibration), pes cavus present since infancy or childhood, and axonal swelling with neurofilament accumulation on nerve biopsy. Other features may include hand muscle involvement, hypo/arreflexia, gait disturbances, muscle cramps, toe abnormalities and mild cardiomyopathy.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Autosomal dominant hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 2 with giant axons
